data.title: Emir Kusturica – Spirit of Fire
data.text:
Emir Kusturica - President

World-famous film director, winner of awards at major European film festivals, including two Palme d'Or at the Cannes Film Festival. Knight of the Order of the Legion of Honor, member of the Academy of Sciences and Arts of Serbia.

Emir Kusturica made his debut in 1978 with the short film “Guernica,” which won the main prize at the student film festival in Karlovy Vary. In 1981, Kusturica made her feature debut with the film Do You Remember Dolly Bell? about the childhood and growing up of a Sarajevo teenager - the first Yugoslav film shot in the Bosnian dialect. He received the prize for best debut film and the FIPRESCI prize at the Venice International Film Festival. It was followed by Dad on a Business Trip (1985, Palme d'Or at Cannes Film Festival), Time of the Gypsies (1988), Arizona Dream (1993), Underground (1995, Palme d'Or at Cannes Film Festival), Black Cat , White Cat" (1998), "Life is a Miracle" (2004) - they entered the golden fund of European cinema and received many festival awards.

In February 2022, in Khanty-Mansiysk, Emir Kusturica received a special prize from the Spirit of Fire festival, and in November became president of the festival.
